etymologies: 1930s. Partly a blend of giga- and million, and partly from G + -illion

definitions: A very large but indefinite number.

notes.text: British Biochemist Normal Wingate Pirie (1907–97) proposed the name ‘gillion’ for a thousand million as a means of avoiding the potential for ambiguity resulting from different uses of the word ‘billion’ in the United States and United Kingdom.
